Text: Generate a short paragraph about 'astronomy' targeting readability level Middle School. Limit the output to 150 words. Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere. It includes the observation of objects like stars, planets, and galaxies, as well as events like eclipses and supernovas. Astronomy has helped us understand the universe's structure and history, from our own solar system to the vast expanse of the cosmos. It also raises intriguing questions about life beyond Earth and the nature of space and time. By gazing up at the night sky, we can explore the mysteries of the universe and feed our curiosity about the world around us.

Text: Generate a short paragraph about 'astronomy' targeting readability level Middle School. Limit the output to 150 words. Astronomy is the science that studies everything outside Earth's atmosphere. It includes the Sun, Moon, stars, galaxies, and even black holes. Astronomers use powerful telescopes to see distant objects and learn about their properties. They also study how these objects move and interact with each other. Some famous astronomers are Galileo Galilei, who made important observations about the solar system, and Edwin Hubble, who discovered that the universe is expanding. By learning about astronomy, we can understand our place in the vast universe and appreciate its beauty and mysteries.
